sentence: Consumer stocks were broadly higher, with shares of consumer staples companies in the S&P 500 climbing just 0.1% while shares of consumer discretionary firms in the S&P 500 were on a nearly 0.7% tear higher Thursday afternoon.

+ Home Depot ( HD ) was edging higher after the home-improvement retailer earlier Thursday said it acquired The Company Store on Tuesday, paying an undisclosed amount to Hanover Direct for the online retailer of textiles and home decor products.
The transaction did not include The Company Store's five retail store locations.

+ Discovery Communications (DISCA,DISCK) pushed out to a more than 6% gain on Thursday, reaching a session high of $23.79 a share after Bank of America Merril Lynch began analyst coverage of the cable channels company with a Neutral rating and a $30 price target.
+ Hasbro ( HAS ) climbed over 1% to a session high of $92.85 a share after analysts at B. Riley & Co. began coverage of the toymaker with a Buy rating and a $108 price target.
The research shop also started covering rival Mattel ( MAT ) with a Neutral rating and a $15 price target.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
